meanings.definition: To surpass in skill or cunning in avoiding something.
meanings.sent1: She was outdodging the obstacles on the obstacle course with ease.
meanings.sent2: The cat was outdodging the dog by climbing up the tree.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outdodging the bird feeder to get to the birdseed.
meanings.sent4: The spy was outdodging the security guards to reach the secret documents.
meanings.sent5: The ninja was outdodging the enemy's attacks with lightning speed.

meanings.definition: The act of avoiding or evading something in a skillful or cunning manner.
meanings.sent1: His outdodging of the questions during the interview impressed the hiring manager.
meanings.sent2: The fox's outdodging of the hunters allowed it to escape into the forest.
meanings.sent3: The magician's outdodging of the audience's guesses left everyone amazed.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's outdodging of the defenders led to a clear path to the goal.
meanings.sent5: The student's outdodging of the difficult test questions surprised the teacher.
